p: Along with flu and respiratory problems, people of all ages are susceptible to COVID-19, and there was no significant gender bias in terms of viral infection [ 2]. Recent researches have revealed that COVID-19 is less lethal in children than adult patients, though some infants were vulnerable to infection [ 20]. Also, prominent changes were seen in the blood coagulation of patients with SARS-CoV-2 infection. The coagulation function in patients with SARS-CoV-2 is significantly unstable in comparison to healthy people [ 21]. It is also reported that the patients with pre-existing cardiovascular metabolic diseases such as hypertension, cardia-cerebrovascular diseases, and diabetes are at a greater risk of developing severe conditions and these pre-existing ailments can also greatly affect the prognosis of the COVID-19 [ 22].
